    "### Calculate Co2 Equivalency"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 820,

   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "malaysia_emissions_df['tCO2_2015'] = (malaysia_emissions_df['tCH4_2015'] * 25)\n",

    "malaysia_emissions_df.loc['mean'] = malaysia_emissions_df.loc[(malaysia_emissions_df['country_name'] != \"Total\")].select_dtypes(np.number).mean()\n",
    "malaysia_emissions_df.at['mean','country_name'] = 'mean'\n",
    "malaysia_emissions_df"

    "# Calculate Means and Totals Across Rows"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 822,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "mean_series = malaysia_emissions_df[['tCH4_2015','tCH4_2016','tCH4_2017','tCH4_2018','tCH4_2019']].select_dtypes(np.number).mean(axis=1)\n",
    "total_series = malaysia_emissions_df[['tCH4_2015','tCH4_2016','tCH4_2017','tCH4_2018','tCH4_2019']].select_dtypes(np.number).sum(axis=1)\n",
    "malaysia_emissions_df[\"Mean_CH4\"] = mean_series\n",
    "malaysia_emissions_df['Total_CH4'] = total_series "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 823,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "## the select np.number is uncecessary, but i'm including anyways as it doesnt really hurt but for a small calculation penalty\n",
    "mean_series = malaysia_emissions_df[['tCO2_2015','tCO2_2016','tCO2_2017','tCO2_2018','tCO2_2019']].select_dtypes(np.number).mean(axis=1)\n",
    "total_series = malaysia_emissions_df[['tCO2_2015','tCO2_2016','tCO2_2017','tCO2_2018','tCO2_2019']].select_dtypes(np.number).sum(axis=1)\n",
    "malaysia_emissions_df[\"Mean_CO2\"] = mean_series\n",
    "malaysia_emissions_df['Total_CO2'] = total_series "
   ]

   "source": [
    "I did not exclude totals or mean from the dataframe, but as we can see the second hump in the density graph shows the distribution of totals annualy.  Interestingly the 2020 data is shifted further to the right than other years.  This actually questions the validity of the study promoted by the University of malaysia"

   "source": [
    "faostat_emissions_df.drop(labels = ['country_fao'], axis=1, inplace=True)\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculate Co2 Equivalency"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 834,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "faostat_emissions_df['tCO2_2015'] = faostat_emissions_df[2015] * 25\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df['tCO2_2016'] = faostat_emissions_df[2016] * 25\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df['tCO2_2017'] = faostat_emissions_df[2017] * 25\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df['tCO2_2018'] = faostat_emissions_df[2018] * 25\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df['tCO2_2019'] = faostat_emissions_df[2019] * 25"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculate Means"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 835,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "faostat_emissions_df.loc['mean'] = faostat_emissions_df.loc[(faostat_emissions_df['country_name'] != \"Total\")].select_dtypes(np.number).mean()\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df.at['mean','country_name'] = 'mean'\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)\n",
    "#faostat_emissions_df.at['mean','country_fao'] = 'mean'\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculate Means and Totals Across Rows"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 836,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "mean_series = faostat_emissions_df[[2015,2016,2017,2018,2019]].select_dtypes(np.number).mean(axis=1)\n",
    "total_series = faostat_emissions_df[[2015,2016,2017,2018,2019]].select_dtypes(np.number).sum(axis=1)\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df[\"Mean_CH4\"] = mean_series\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df['Total_CH4'] = total_series "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 837,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "## the select np.number is uncecessary, but i'm including anyways as it doesnt really hurt but for a small calculation penalty\n",
    "mean_series = faostat_emissions_df[['tCO2_2015','tCO2_2016','tCO2_2017','tCO2_2018','tCO2_2019']].select_dtypes(np.number).mean(axis=1)\n",
    "total_series = faostat_emissions_df[['tCO2_2015','tCO2_2016','tCO2_2017','tCO2_2018','tCO2_2019']].select_dtypes(np.number).sum(axis=1)\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df[\"Mean_CO2\"] = mean_series\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df['Total_CO2'] = total_series "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 838,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "faostat_emissions_df.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)"
   ]

   "source": [
    "The density plot is fairly consistent.  There is nearly no variation between nations and in total.  The 2020 data may show otherwise as the Malaysian data shows.  "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Join Df's by ISO3 Country"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Drop totals and means from the original df.\n",
    "\n",
    "Because I am joining on iso3 country country code if the totals and means are located at different indexes we may experience merge and calculation errors"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 843,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "faostat_emissions_df = faostat_emissions_df[(faostat_emissions_df[\"country_name\"] != \"Total\") & (faostat_emissions_df['country_name'] != 'mean')].copy()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 844,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "malaysia_emissions_df = malaysia_emissions_df[(malaysia_emissions_df[\"country_name\"] != \"Total\") & (malaysia_emissions_df['country_name'] != 'mean')].copy()"
   ]

    "### Dropping 2020 and 2021 from the data sets"

  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculate difference in Ch4 Tonnes Between the Estimates"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 850,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Calculate Difference in tons\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_diff_2015'] = merged_df[2015] - merged_df['tCH4_2015']\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_diff_2016'] = merged_df[2016] - merged_df['tCH4_2016']\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_diff_2017'] = merged_df[2017] - merged_df['tCH4_2017']\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_diff_2018'] = merged_df[2018] - merged_df['tCH4_2018']\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_diff_2019'] = merged_df[2019] - merged_df['tCH4_2019']\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_diff_means'] = merged_df['Mean_CH4_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['Mean_CH4_TRACE']\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_diff_totals'] = merged_df['Total_CH4_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['Total_CH4_TRACE']\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",

  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculate difference in C02 Tonnes Between the Estimates"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 852,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Calculate Difference in tons\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_diff_2015'] = merged_df['tCO2_2015_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['tCO2_2015_TRACE']\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_diff_2016'] = merged_df['tCO2_2016_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['tCO2_2016_TRACE']\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_diff_2017'] = merged_df['tCO2_2017_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['tCO2_2017_TRACE']\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_diff_2018'] = merged_df['tCO2_2018_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['tCO2_2018_TRACE']\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_diff_2019'] = merged_df['tCO2_2019_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['tCO2_2019_TRACE']\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_diff_means'] = merged_df['Mean_CO2_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['Mean_CO2_TRACE']\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_diff_totals'] = merged_df['Total_CO2_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['Total_CO2_TRACE']\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculating the CH4 Percent Differences Between the Estimates"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 853,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "## Calculate Percent Differnces on this data set )*100\n",
    "# With raw data i could have accomplished this with a groupby.aggregate(lambda x ), however the pivot tables given are not easy to apply #vectorized functions across time series\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_abs_percent_diff_2015'] = ((abs(merged_df[2015] - merged_df['tCH4_2015']))/((merged_df[2015] + merged_df['tCH4_2015'])/2))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_abs_percent_diff_2016'] = ((abs((merged_df[2016] - merged_df['tCH4_2016']))/((merged_df[2016] + merged_df['tCH4_2016'])/2)))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_abs_percent_diff_2017'] = ((abs(merged_df[2017] - merged_df['tCH4_2017']))/((merged_df[2017] + merged_df['tCH4_2017'])/2))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_abs_percent_diff_2018'] = (abs((merged_df[2018] - merged_df['tCH4_2018']))/((merged_df[2018] + merged_df['tCH4_2018'])/2))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_abs_percent_diff_2019'] = (abs((merged_df[2019] - merged_df['tCH4_2019']))/((merged_df[2019] + merged_df['tCH4_2019'])/2))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_abs_percent_diff_means'] = (abs((merged_df['Mean_CH4_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['Mean_CH4_TRACE']))/((merged_df['Mean_CH4_FAOSTAT'] + merged_df['Mean_CH4_TRACE'])/2))* 100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_abs_percent_diff_totals'] = (abs((merged_df['Total_CH4_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['Total_CH4_TRACE']))/((merged_df['Total_CH4_TRACE'] + merged_df['Total_CH4_FAOSTAT'])/2))*100\n",
    "\n",
    "\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_relative_percent_diff_2015'] = ((merged_df[2015] - merged_df['tCH4_2015'])/(merged_df[2015]))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_relative_percent_diff_2016'] = ((merged_df[2016] - merged_df['tCH4_2016'])/(merged_df[2016]))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_relative_percent_diff_2017'] = ((merged_df[2017] - merged_df['tCH4_2017'])/(merged_df[2017]))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_relative_percent_diff_2018'] = ((merged_df[2018] - merged_df['tCH4_2018'])/(merged_df[2018]))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_relative_percent_diff_2019'] = ((merged_df[2019] - merged_df['tCH4_2019'])/(merged_df[2019]))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_relative_percent_diff_means'] = ((merged_df['Mean_CH4_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['Mean_CH4_TRACE'])/(merged_df[\"Mean_CH4_FAOSTAT\"]))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CH4_relative_percent_diff_totals'] = ((merged_df['Total_CH4_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['Total_CH4_TRACE'])/(merged_df[\"Total_CH4_FAOSTAT\"]))*100\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculate CO2 Differences "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 854,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "## Calculate Percent Differnces on this data set )*100\n",
    "# With raw data i could have accomplished this with a groupby.aggregate(lambda x ), however the pivot tables given are not easy to apply #vectorized functions across time series\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_abs_percent_diff_2015'] = (abs((merged_df['tCO2_2015_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['tCO2_2015_TRACE']))/((merged_df['tCO2_2015_TRACE'] + merged_df['tCO2_2015_FAOSTAT'])/2))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_abs_percent_diff_2016'] = ((abs(merged_df['tCO2_2016_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['tCO2_2016_TRACE']))/((merged_df['tCO2_2016_TRACE'] + merged_df['tCO2_2016_FAOSTAT'])/2))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_abs_percent_diff_2017'] = ((abs(merged_df['tCO2_2017_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['tCO2_2017_TRACE']))/((merged_df['tCO2_2017_TRACE'] + merged_df['tCO2_2017_FAOSTAT'])/2))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_abs_percent_diff_2018'] = ((abs(merged_df['tCO2_2018_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['tCO2_2018_TRACE']))/((merged_df['tCO2_2018_TRACE'] + merged_df['tCO2_2018_FAOSTAT'])/2))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_abs_percent_diff_2019'] = ((abs(merged_df['tCO2_2019_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['tCO2_2019_TRACE']))/((merged_df['tCO2_2019_TRACE'] + merged_df['tCO2_2019_FAOSTAT'])/2))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_abs_percent_diff_means'] = ((abs(merged_df['Mean_CO2_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['Mean_CO2_TRACE']))/((merged_df['Mean_CO2_FAOSTAT'] + merged_df['Mean_CO2_TRACE'])/2))* 100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_abs_percent_diff_totals'] = ((abs(merged_df['Total_CO2_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['Total_CO2_TRACE']))/((merged_df['Total_CO2_TRACE'] + merged_df['Total_CO2_FAOSTAT'])/2))*100\n",
    "\n",
    "\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_relative_percent_diff_2015'] = ((merged_df['tCO2_2015_FAOSTAT']  - merged_df['tCO2_2015_TRACE'])/(merged_df['tCO2_2015_FAOSTAT']))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_relative_percent_diff_2016'] = ((merged_df['tCO2_2016_FAOSTAT']  - merged_df['tCO2_2016_TRACE'])/(merged_df['tCO2_2016_FAOSTAT']))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_relative_percent_diff_2017'] = ((merged_df['tCO2_2017_FAOSTAT']  - merged_df['tCO2_2017_TRACE'])/(merged_df['tCO2_2017_FAOSTAT']))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_relative_percent_diff_2018'] = ((merged_df['tCO2_2018_FAOSTAT']  - merged_df['tCO2_2018_TRACE'])/(merged_df['tCO2_2018_FAOSTAT']))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_relative_percent_diff_2019'] = ((merged_df['tCO2_2019_FAOSTAT']  - merged_df['tCO2_2019_TRACE'])/(merged_df['tCO2_2019_FAOSTAT']))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_relative_percent_diff_means'] = ((merged_df[\"Mean_CO2_FAOSTAT\"] - merged_df['Mean_CO2_TRACE'])/(merged_df[\"Mean_CO2_FAOSTAT\"]))*100\n",
    "merged_df['CO2_relative_percent_diff_totals'] = ((merged_df['Total_CO2_FAOSTAT'] - merged_df['Total_CO2_TRACE'])/(merged_df[\"Total_CO2_FAOSTAT\"]))*100"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 855,

  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Impressions"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "#### Initial \n",
    "\n",
    "The percent difference and the tonnege difference do not support each other.  I need to recalculate the totals section to ensure that we are doing things correctly.  \n",
    "\n",
    "I need to confirm the values, but I'm initially impressed by the fact that the faostat data reports higher values than the malaysia data on average.  According to the included paper this shold not be the case.  \n",
    "\n",
    "The quote included below states the problems with the malysia methodology.  \n",
    "\n",
    "\"The difference between harvested rice cultivation area from statistical data and remote-sensing estimates can be due to two factors: (i) MODIS data which have moderate spatial resolution lead to mixed pixels, where rice fields and non-rice fields are combined. This can overestimate area, especially in lowland regions and have a low ability to detect small rice field patches in upland regions (Frolking et al 1999, Seto et al 2000); and (ii) political and policy factors (Yan et al., 2019) such as determination of the amount of subsidies for fertilizers and evaluation of achievement of government programs in the agricultural sector.\n",
    "Other factors that contribute to discrepancy in CH4 emission are from different emission and scale factors that are related to water regime and organic amendment. These values give high uncertainty since the availability of these data are limited and quite variable.\""
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "#### Verified\n",
    "\n",
    "I calculated differences totals and means per dataframe to ensure accuracy prior to the join.  I also dropped precalcuated values when joining to ensure that the aggregation algorithms to not modify the results. \n",
    "\n",
    "The data is now consistent and supports the findings of the University of Malaysia Paper  "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Recreating the Malysia Paper.  "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### University of Malaysia Data"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 866,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "filepath = \"/Users/jnapolitano/Projects/wattime-takehome/data/ch4_2015-2021.xlsx\"\n",
    "\n",
    "malaysia_emissions_df = pd.read_excel(filepath)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 867,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Selecting 2020 columns\n",
    "malaysia_2020 = malaysia_emissions_df[[\"iso3_country\",\"country_name\", \"tCH4_2020\"]].copy()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 868,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [

  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculate difference in Tonnes Between the Estimates"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 875,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Calculate Difference in tons\n",
    "merged2020_df['diff_2020'] = merged2020_df[2019] - merged2020_df['tCH4_2020']\n",
    "\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculating the Percent Differences Between the Estimates"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 890,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "merged2020_df['abs_percent_diff_2020'] = (abs((merged2020_df[2019] - merged2020_df['tCH4_2020']))/(merged2020_df[2019] + merged2020_df[\"tCH4_2020\"])/2)*100\n",
    "\n",
    "merged2020_df['relative_percent_diff_2020'] = (merged2020_df[2019] - merged2020_df['tCH4_2020'])/(merged2020_df[2019])*100\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },

    "## FAOSTAT Data 2018"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": null,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "filepath = \"/Users/jnapolitano/Projects/wattime-takehome/data/emissions_csv_fao_emiss_csv_ch4_fao_2015_2019_tonnes.xlsx\"\n",
    "\n",
    "faostat_emissions_df = pd.read_excel(filepath)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 893,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "faostat_2018 = faostat_emissions_df[['code', 'country', 'country_fao', 2018]].copy()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 894,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/html": [
       "<div>\n",
       "<style scoped>\n",
       "    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {\n",
       "        vertical-align: middle;\n",
       "    }\n",
       "\n",
       "    .dataframe tbody tr th {\n",
       "        vertical-align: top;\n",
       "    }\n",
       "\n",
       "    .dataframe thead th {\n",
       "        text-align: right;\n",
       "    }\n",
       "</style>\n",
       "<table border=\"1\" class=\"dataframe\">\n",
       "  <thead>\n",

       "0                                    Bangladesh  2.106781e+06  \n",
       "1                                        Brazil  4.902874e+05  \n",
       "2                                         China  6.402353e+06  \n",

       "13                                      Myanmar  1.221904e+06  \n",
       "14                                     Malaysia  1.127141e+05  \n",
       "15                                        Nepal  7.168401e+04  \n",

       "17                            Philippines (the)  4.462836e+05  \n",

     "execution_count": 897,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "merged2020_df"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculate difference in Tonnes Between the Estimates"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 899,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Calculate Difference in tons\n",
    "merged2020_df['diff_2020'] = merged2020_df[2018] - merged2020_df['tCH4_2020']\n",
    "\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculating the Percent Differences Between the Estimates"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 900,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "merged2020_df['abs_percent_diff_2020'] = (abs((merged2020_df[2018] - merged2020_df['tCH4_2020']))/(merged2020_df[2018] + merged2020_df[\"tCH4_2020\"])/2)*100\n",
    "\n",
    "merged2020_df['relative_percent_diff_2020'] = (merged2020_df[2018] - merged2020_df['tCH4_2020'])/(merged2020_df[2018])*100\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {

   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculate difference in Tonnes Between the Estimates"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 924,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Calculate Difference in tons\n",
    "merged2018_df['diff_2018'] = merged2018_df[2018] - merged2018_df['tCH4_2018']\n",
    "\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculating the Percent Differences Between the Estimates"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 925,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "merged2018_df['abs_percent_diff_2018'] = (abs((merged2018_df[2018] - merged2018_df['tCH4_2018']))/(merged2018_df[2018] + merged2018_df[\"tCH4_2018\"])/2)*100\n",
    "\n",
    "merged2018_df['relative_percent_diff_2018'] = (merged2018_df[2018] - merged2018_df['tCH4_2018'])/(merged2018_df[2018])*100\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 926,
   "metadata": {},

  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Impressions"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "I was not able to replicate the results exactly.  I reviewed the included paper to find that the university misleadingly rounded to three decimal places.  I did not manipulate the raw data.  \n",
    "\n",
    "I found that the overall difference in reporting is only about 6 percent between 2019 and 2020.   The methodology is somewhat misleading as well, because when considering the previous 5 years of data demonstrated a consistent 3 percent difference.  When comparing the TRACE data to itself it does seem to show a significant increase between 2019 and 2020 emissions. I'll test this next  "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Hypothesis Testing the Malaysian Data"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Claims\n",
    "\n",
    "* That the distributions do not differ between 2020 and 2019\n",
    "* That the means do no differ between 2020 and 2019"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## What will be testing.  \n",
    "\n",
    "* That the Data are independent and evenly distributed: Test for normality\n",
    "    * Shapiro-Wilk Test\n",
    "* That the means between 2019 and 2020 do not differ: Parametric Statistical Hypothesis Tests\n",
    "    * T Test because we have less than 25 observations\n",
    "* If nonparametirc: That the distributions between 2019 and 2020 do not differ\n",
    "    Mann-Whitney U Test\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Data Import\n",
    "I am importing data again to ensure that our data is valid.  I will move this section to another notebook when the work is completed.  This file must be very large at this point."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 880,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "filepath = \"/Users/jnapolitano/Projects/wattime-takehome/data/ch4_2015-2021.xlsx\"\n",
    "\n",
    "hypothesis_testing_df = pd.read_excel(filepath)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Drop total row from the data"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 881,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "hypothesis_testing_df = hypothesis_testing_df.loc[(hypothesis_testing_df['country_name'] != \"Total\")].copy() #copying to avoid modifying slices in memory.  Old df should also drop from memory in production environment."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",

    "### Test for Normality: Shapiro-Wilk"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "#### 2019"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 883,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "0     2.070985e+06\n",
       "1     3.294713e+05\n",
       "2     5.603352e+06\n",
       "3     1.148324e+04\n",
       "4     1.266668e+06\n",
       "5     7.501556e+06\n",
       "6     9.500199e+04\n",
       "7     4.566914e+04\n",
       "8     2.332056e+05\n",
       "9     5.947277e+05\n",
       "10    1.327782e+05\n",
       "11    1.461058e+04\n",
       "12    8.476088e+04\n",
       "13    1.256888e+06\n",
       "14    1.056287e+05\n",
       "15    1.164235e+05\n",
       "16    6.528548e+05\n",
       "17    3.584550e+05\n",
       "18    9.655062e+04\n",
       "19    1.305046e+06\n",
       "20    8.990870e+04\n",
       "21    1.691351e+05\n",
       "22    1.269751e+06\n",
       "Name: tCH4_2019, dtype: float64"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 883,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "## Selecting Malaysia 2019 Data \n",
    "data_2019 = hypothesis_testing_df['tCH4_2019']\n",
    "data_2019"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 884,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "stat=0.567, p=0.000\n",
      "Probably not Gaussian\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "results = stats.shapiro(data_2019)\n",
    "print('stat=%.3f, p=%.3f' % (results.statistic, results.pvalue))\n",
    "if results.pvalue > 0.05:\n",
    "\tprint('Probably Gaussian')\n",
    "else:\n",
    "\tprint('Probably not Gaussian')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "##### Results\n",
    "\n",
    "The distribution is not gausian so a non-paremtric test must be completed.  It is not necessary to perform this test on the 2020 data, but I will do so anyways for practice."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "#### 2020"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 885,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "## Selecting the Malaysia Data 2020\n",
    "data_2020 = hypothesis_testing_df['tCH4_2020']"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 886,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "stat=0.565, p=0.000\n",
      "Probably not Gaussian\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "results = stats.shapiro(data_2020)\n",
    "print('stat=%.3f, p=%.3f' % (results.statistic, results.pvalue))\n",
    "if results.pvalue > 0.05:\n",
    "\tprint('Probably Gaussian')\n",
    "else:\n",
    "\tprint('Probably not Gaussian')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "##### Results\n",
    "\n",
    "The 2020 data is not gausian which verifies that we will need to perform a non parmetric test"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Independence of Samples.  \n",
    "We have to assume that the samples are independent of each other as we know they are dependent on hecatares.  \n",
    "Though the correlations are rather high this is due to the smiliarity of hectares per year.  Thus the amount of ch4 is similiar\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Distribution Similiarity"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "#### Mann-Whitney U Test"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 887,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "stat=266.000, p=0.982\n",
      "Probably the same distribution\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Example of the Mann-Whitney U Test\n",
    "\n",
    "stat, p = stats.mannwhitneyu(data_2019, data_2020)\n",
    "print('stat=%.3f, p=%.3f' % (stat, p))\n",
    "if p > 0.05:\n",
    "\tprint('Probably the same distribution')\n",
    "else:\n",
    "\tprint('Probably different distributions')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Kruskal Wallis test"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 888,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "stat=0.001, p=0.974\n",
      "Probably the same distribution\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "\n",
    "stat, p = stats.kruskal(data_2019, data_2020)\n",
    "print('stat=%.3f, p=%.3f' % (stat, p))\n",
    "if p > 0.05:\n",
    "\tprint('Probably the same distribution')\n",
    "else:\n",
    "\tprint('Probably different distributions')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Friedman Test\n",
    "\n",
    "Just for the sake of it I will compare data across all distributions"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 889,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "stat=11.472, p=0.043\n",
      "Probably different distributions\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Example of the Friedman Test\n",
    "#data_2014 = hypothesis_testing_df['tCH4_2014']\n",
    "data_2015 = hypothesis_testing_df['tCH4_2015']\n",
    "data_2016 = hypothesis_testing_df['tCH4_2016']\n",
    "data_2017 = hypothesis_testing_df['tCH4_2017']\n",
    "data_2018 = hypothesis_testing_df['tCH4_2018']\n",
    "\n",
    "stat, p = stats.friedmanchisquare(data_2015, data_2016, data_2017, data_2018, data_2019, data_2020)\n",
    "print('stat=%.3f, p=%.3f' % (stat, p))\n",
    "if p > 0.05:\n",
    "\tprint('Probably the same distribution')\n",
    "else:\n",
    "\tprint('Probably different distributions')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "#### Results.  \n",
    "\n",
    "Some distributions differ from one another.  Which those are have yet to be discovered.  For the sake of this analysis I will not attempt to identify them.  \n",
    "\n",
    "The statment that the distributions of the 2019 and 2020 data do not differ cannot differ.  That said we also cannot claim that the means are statistically equivalent as the data is not parametric.  \n",
    "\n"
   ]
  }
